decision_conditions: In the event that contamination is found (at any time) that was not previously identified, development shall cease and the contamination reported in writing to the local planning authority as soon as is reasonably practicable. An assessment, remediation scheme and verification report shall then be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority before development resumes.Reason: To ensure that risks from land contamination are minimised, in accordance with policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The development to which this permission relates shall be carried out in accordance with the materials specified on the approved plans and on the submitted application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development, in accordance with Policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and Policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The buildings and uses to which this permission relates shall be demolished/ceased and the land shall be restored to its former condition on or before 12 April 2023.Reason: In the interests of the character and appearance of the area and to safeguard Metropolitan Open Land, in accordance with policies D3 and G3 of the London Plan 2021 and policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Notwithstanding Section 55 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended) and the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended) (or any Order revoking and reenacting that Order with or without modification), the premises shall only be used for the purposes specified in the application documents and for no other purposes whatsoever (including any other purposes falling within the same use classes) of the Schedule to the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 (or any provision equivalent to that class in any Order revoking and reenacting that Order with or without modification).Reason: The acceptability of the development is highly dependent upon the exact nature of the use of the site and other uses, whether within the same use class or permitted by the General Permitted Development Order, are unlikely to be acceptable in planning terms.

The cycle parking facilities shall be constructed in accordance with the Cycle Parking Details dated 13/02/2018 and approved as part of the original planning permission (ref. 17/15279/FUL) prior to beneficial occupation of the development to which this permission relates and shall be retained for that purpose and kept free from obstruction for the lifetime of the development.Reason: To ensure that appropriate opportunities to promote sustainable transport are taken up, in accordance with policy T5 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS6 and DM8 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The car parking shown on the approved plans shall be provided with a hard-bound, adequately-drained, dust-free surface prior to beneficial occupation of the development to which this permission relates and shall thereafter be retained and kept free from obstruction for the lifetime of the development. It shall not be used for any purposes other than the parking of vehicles for the occupiers of and visitors to the development.Reason: To ensure the provision of adequate off-street parking in the interests of the safety and operation of the highway network, in accordance with policies T4 and T6 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS7 and DM9 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The use to which this permission relates shall not open outside of the following hours:0800 to 2100 Monday to Friday0900 to 1800 on Saturdays0900 to 1800 on Sundays and bank holidaysReason: To ensure satisfactory living conditions for neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The development shall be carried out in accordance with the Construction Management Plan dated 04/04/2018 and approved as part of the original planning permission (ref. 17/15279/FUL).Reason: In order to safeguard the amenities of the surrounding residential occupiers and in the interests of the safety and operation of the highway network, in accordance with policies T4 and T7 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS7 and DM9 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Prior to beneficial occupation of the development to which this permission relates, the drainage system as shown in the Flood Risk Statement and Temporary Drainage Strategy-EPG-9497-Ltr-01 dated 08/04/2021 shall be implemented in full and maintained as such for the lifetime of the development.Reason: To prevent the development from increasing the risk of flooding to the site itself or elsewhere, in accordance with policy SI13 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS1 and DM4 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

A minimum of one car parking space shall be made available as an accessible car parking space, which shall be provided prior to beneficial occupation of the development and thereafter retained as such for the lifetime of the development.Reason: To ensure the provision of adequate off-street parking in the interests of the safety and operation of the highway network, in accordance with policies T4 and T6 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS7 and DM9 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

One car parking space shall be provided with active provision for electric vehicle charging prior to beneficial occupation of the development to which this permission relates and shall thereafter be retained as such for the lifetime of the development.Reason: To ensure the provision of adequate off-street parking in the interests of the safety and operation of the highway network, in accordance with policy T6 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS7 and DM9 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

description: Application under Section 73 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 to carry out development without compliance with Condition 2 (Approved Plans) of Planning Permission ref: 17/15279/FUL (Erection of temporary single storey buildings to provide welfare, changing and security facilities (Class D2). Alterations to existing buildings to allow use for storage of groundsman's equipment (Class D2). Provision of CCTV, refurbishment/repair works to internal access road and car park to provide temporary car park and service layout. Pitch enhancement works including alterations to levels, pitch construction and subsoil, replacement drainage, ducting for services including under soil heating and pitch irrigation and associated temporary fencing and ball stop netting) to allow for the following changes to car park layout, additional portacabins, Covid Testing Areas, changing rooms/areas, toilets/showers, canteen area/kitchen, gym/exercise/warm down area, classroom/match analysis and medical area in association with the transfer of facilities and services/activities back to Motspur Park
